data.name: CoreSkillsLine1
data.value: Design Systems and UI Craft: component patterns, WPF styling, ResourceDictionary architecture, design tokens mindset, visual states, interaction consistency, UI polish

data.name: CoreSkillsLine2
data.value: WPF and C#: WPF, XAML, C# 7.3, MVVM, binding, commands, DependencyProperty, ControlTemplate, DataTemplate, converters, behaviors

data.name: CoreSkillsLine3
data.value: Prototyping and Visual Design: Adobe Photoshop (high-fidelity UI mockups since 2001), visual hierarchy, layout composition, iterative prototyping

data.name: CoreSkillsLine4
data.value: Performance and Responsiveness: perceived performance, smooth scrolling, UI responsiveness, virtualization awareness, profiling mindset

data.name: CoreSkillsLine5
data.value: Localization Readiness: resx-based resources, bilingual UX structure, text expansion awareness, layout resilience

data.name: CoreSkillsLine6
data.value: Collaboration and Leadership: UI guidance to developers, standards and review support, cross-team alignment, iterative refinement with stakeholders and QA

data.name: DesignSystemBullet1
data.value: UI foundations: consistent spacing, typography rhythm, color decisions, and layout hierarchy across screens.

data.name: DesignSystemBullet2
data.value: Reusable UI: styles, templates, and custom controls that standardize states and interaction patterns (default, hover, pressed, disabled, loading, validation).

data.name: DesignSystemBullet3
data.value: Theming: light and dark mode driven by centralized resources to keep UI consistent across modules.

data.name: DesignSystemBullet4
data.value: Prototyping workflow: Photoshop mockups that translate into implementation-ready UI decisions and faster cross-team alignment.

data.name: HighlightBullet1
data.value: Led front-end modernization of a flagship desktop product by migrating the UI to WPF and refreshing the visual language during the transition to Creaform.OS, improving consistency across multiple modules and screens, with strong internal feedback.

data.name: HighlightBullet2
data.value: Drove UI direction across projects by defining styling rules and interaction patterns, for example reusable card layouts, consistent button and input states, unified window chrome and title bar behavior, and timeline-style navigation patterns, helping teams ship cohesive, polished UI at scale.

data.name: HighlightBullet3
data.value: Produced high-fidelity Photoshop UI mockups and click-through prototypes for both marketing and development, enabling early validation and reducing late-cycle rework.

data.name: HighlightBullet4
data.value: Designed and delivered a new interface for peel.OS and contributed to peel 3 by Creaform, focusing on information hierarchy, navigation clarity, and reusable WPF patterns (styles, templates, states).

data.name: HighlightBullet5
data.value: Built a personal WPF productivity app to accelerate professional photo editing workflows, using it as a UI playground for theming, localization, and interactive controls, including batch import, guided renaming, and productivity-focused quick actions.

data.name: SummaryExperienceLine
data.value: Experience: 7+ years in software development, 5+ years focused on WPF desktop UI.

data.name: SummaryText
data.value: Senior UI-focused software developer specializing in WPF desktop applications, UI modernization, and design-system execution. I lead UI delivery with a strong standard for consistency, interaction polish, and usability, balancing visual craft with real product constraints. Known for high-fidelity Photoshop mockups that speed up alignment and reduce rework, plus production-ready WPF implementation habits (reusable components, centralized styling, clean interaction patterns, localization-ready structure).

data.name: TimelineControlInteractionsHelpText
data.value: Click the timeline, use the mouse wheel to zoom, drag to pan with inertia, click a bar or anywhere on the timeline to select a date.

data.name: VisualCraftText
data.value: Professional photographer since 2010 with 20+ years of photo editing experience (since 2001). Visual craft strengthens UI outcomes through disciplined composition, clear visual hierarchy, brand consistency, and detail-level polish.
